title: This wild Doom 2 mod that blends World War 1 combat with a vicious holy war just unleashed a gnarly prequel campaign where you assault a mountain riddled with heretics
partialText: Butcher's Summit is a prequel to the ambitious total conversion Trench Foot.

title: Fish wrangling management sim Megaquarium is getting a major free update alongside its upcoming DLC: 'I've learned a lot over the years about what makes a good Megaquarium campaign'
partialText: World of tanks.

title: Age verification checks are now in force in the UK because of the Online Safety Act, but with the Discord fallout, it seems like one bad idea after another
partialText: Data disaster.

title: Cities: Skylines 2's new developer celebrates the occasion with a debut patch all about death, making citizens pop their clogs around the clock and removing immortality in easy mode: 'Previously, about 80% of them never died of old age'
partialText: Fear the reaper.

title: Total Chaos, the survival horror based on one of Doom's best mods, is getting a New Game+ mode featuring an Alien: Isolation-style persistent enemy: 'It does not patrol. It does not follow rules. It adapts'
partialText: "There are no safe zones."

title: Well, someone made an Ulfric Stormcloak Big Naturals mod
partialText: And they call the Imperials "milk-drinkers".

title: Roblox responds to LA County lawsuit, the latest of many alleging the game fails to protect children from predators: 'While no system can be perfect, our commitment to safety never ends'
partialText: The civil suit calls Roblox's online social space "largely unsupervised."

title: High flying FPS Ultrakill will finally reach the 8th layer of Hell next week: 'Skip school. Call out sick from work. It's finally happening. And we're not lying'
partialText: Honest advertising for Fraud.

title: This musical RPG is doing important work by letting you beat up music snobs, but I really stuck around for the painful (brilliant) puns
partialText: I'm easily entertained.

title: Avowed was always great, but now that it costs what it should have at launch and nobody's being weird about it online, it's kinda perfect
partialText: A permanent $20 price cut may be the most transformative patch of all.

title: Saints Row 1 designer reckons the series is 'dead,' adding that Embracer 'ghosted' him after a comeback pitch: 'I wish things were different'
partialText: The Third Street Saints won't go marching in anytime soon.

title: Ubisoft made another Avatar game the world has forgotten about, so I opened Pandora’s boxed copy and dropped into the jungle
partialText: It's as if Apocalypse Now was made in 10 months rather than 10 years.

title: To celebrate 2 years of Balatro, creator LocalThunk reflected on dropping out of an engineering program to make games: 'Even if I could warn myself I’m not sure what I could have said to prepare for the insanity'
partialText: "Thank you to everyone for allowing this terrible student to keep staying up too late."

title: You'll need an expansion pack for your brain to get all 20 questions right in our dastardly new DLC quiz
partialText: How well do you know your downloadable content?

title: Helldivers 2's siege of Cyberstan is the greatest galactic campaign the game has seen so far
partialText: They have the plans for the Death Sta- Wait, I mean the "Star of Peace".

title: Interdimensional railway sim Voidtrain gets a patch that expands your inventory, a 50% discount and new DLC that's free until Monday
partialText: Welcome alien pets aboard your train in Voidtrain: Tour de Void.

title: The Logitech Superstrike has allowed me to get excited over some genuinely new PC gaming technology for the first time in what feels like forever
partialText: It will join the likes of X3D processors, Hall effect keyboards, and OLED monitors.

title: Heart of the Machine, the strategy game that lets you be the fun kind of evil AI, leaves early access in March with two possible endings: 'One is focussed on committing ALL the war crimes'
partialText: Full heart.

title: Turn water into goo and yourself into a cloud in this fantasy adventure with 102 million spell combinations: 'The core ethos when it comes to solving puzzles is to do it your way'
partialText: Learn to spell well in Rhell: Warped World & Troubled Times.

title: Age of Empires 2: Definitive Edition gets yet another massive update adding a new line of warships and 'significant changes' to naval mechanics
partialText: The Last Chieftains DLC is also available now.

title: A beginner's guide to installing Stardew Valley mods: SMAPI, Stardrop, and more
partialText: Set up SMAPI, find your mod folder, and use the Stardrop mod manager.

title: If Xbox is 'recommitting' to its console, what does that mean for its recent 'everything is an Xbox' strategy?
partialText: Divining meaning from the words of Microsoft Gaming's new CEO.

title: No layoffs at Xbox as a result of leadership shakeup, new chief content officer Matt Booty says: 'My focus is on supporting the teams and leaders we have in place and creating the conditions for them to do their best work'
partialText: We'll see how long that lasts.

title: New Xbox boss promises no 'soulless AI slop' after moving over from Microsoft's CoreAI products division
partialText: "We will not chase short-term efficiency or flood our ecosystem with soulless AI slop," said Asha Sharma, the new CEO of Microsoft Gaming.

title: Players spent roughly 10,250,000,000 monthly hours in Roblox in 2025, analyst says—more than Steam, PlayStation, and Fortnite combined
partialText: Roblox alone accounted for 67% of the games industry's growth outside of China in 2025.

title: Warlocks have taken the throne as Diablo 2's best class 26 years later, and Blizzard seems to be OK with letting them have their fun for now
partialText: The older classes aren't as far behind as you might think, though.

title: DICE agrees that some Battlefield 6 vehicles are 'death traps' and is planning a Labs test dedicated to 'vehicle improvements'
partialText: Will the jeep finally be worth using?

title: Xbox boss Phil Spencer is retiring, and his replacement is an AI executive who joined Microsoft in 2024
partialText: Sarah Bond, who was widely expected to take the reins one day, has instead resigned from the company.

title: Ubisoft CEO confirms new Assassin's Creed and Far Cry games are coming, denies that putting his son in charge of them was nepotism
partialText: Well what did you expect him to say?

title: Imagine if politics were full of monsters! Haha, no, I mean fun monsters like vampires, orcs, and goblins who use cards to hurl insults and smears at each other
partialText: Fight your way to the top of the government in card-based roguelike Prime Monster.

title: Nothing beats putting all my little stuff on my many little shelves in a super cozy shop sim like Thrifty Business
partialText: I love to organize my hoard of junk.

title: Arc Raiders proves it has one of the most wholesome fanbases once again, as a stranger spends 15 minutes painstakingly escorting a downed raider to safety
partialText: "He never said a word but escorted me 15 minutes to a hatch."

title: Security researchers claim Persona, the provider behind Discord's UK age verification 'experiment', performs '269 individual verification checks' on user data, including those for terrorism and espionage
partialText: I'm sure this will be well-received.

title: Skate is locking a map area behind a paywall after promising no map areas would be locked behind paywalls: 'We will need to make changes as we go sometimes'
partialText: Goofy.

title: Corsair introduces two new case colours 'that change tone as light moves across the surface' and from where I'm standing, they look fire
partialText: And I, for one, can't wait to see it under the harsh light of a monitor, as that's where it will spend most of its time.

title: After breaking Winston's heart last week, Overwatch players have abandoned Talon in this week's vote, and it's all down to the cat
partialText: Never forget your roots.

title: Capcom pleads with its community once again to avoid sharing Resident Evil Requiem leaks: 'We really want everyone to enjoy the game's story and experience as much as possible'
partialText: Resident Evil Requiem fans just have to hold out another week.

title: Embark's plans to rework Arc Raiders' account-wiping Expeditions: 'We didn't have time to shift the system to what we intend to do next'
partialText: It may be an optional system, but Embark acknowledges there's work to be done to improve wipes.

title: Arc Raiders is such a huge hit, Nexon has put Embark Studios CEO Patrick Söderlund in charge of everything else too
partialText: Söderlund has been named executive chairman of Nexon, heading up "long-term strategy, creative direction, and how Nexon develops games globally."

title: Todd Howard has 'softened' on remasters, but he's still 'anti-remake'
partialText: Although, let's be honest, Oblivion Remastered blurred the line between the two a little bit.

title: Mchose L7 Pro+ review
partialText: Light in weight and light on price.

title: This simulation of how an old 8-bit processor fetches data from ROM is a thing of beauty
partialText: Look at the pretty colours.

title: Renewed hopes of a Nier: Automata sequel as the cult action RPG's 9th-anniversary livestream ends with a teasing message
partialText: 2B or not 2B?

title: There could be a new God of War project involving new Kratos' voice actor Christopher Judge revealed 'late summer', but nobody should feel great about how that news broke
partialText: "I have other projects that I am super excited about."

title: Arc Raiders' wall-breaking exploits took so long to fix because they were 'intrinsic to the way the game is built': 'Those things are very risky to patch rapidly'
partialText: Making games remains hard, in case you had any doubts.

title: The Future Games Show returns this March with the voices of Lae'zel and Batman as hosts
partialText: Devora Wilde and Shai Matheson have a whole lotta news to share this March 12.

title: A Resident Evil Requiem pull-up bar bundle sold out in Japan in less than five hours, and honestly, it just makes sense
partialText: Capcom has teamed up with a Japanese TV shopping channel, and it's beautifully absurd.

title: If I had just set a new world record for GPU overclocking, I'd surely be making a lot more fuss about it than AMD has
partialText: Hitting 4,769 MHz on any GPU is no small feat.

title: The best Geralt, Doug Cockle, completed The Witcher 3, got the best ending, and was driven 'bonkers' by the Bloody Baron quest
partialText: And now we know he's got a thing for red heads.

title: Acer and Asus' German websites are down in wake of lawsuit, but Acer says its own will 'be up again shortly' so customers can get BIOS updates again
partialText: Updating BIOS is already a pain as is.
